item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition delayed to unannounced date
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Delay "due to the need for significant updates."

Dragami Games has delayed Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition from its previously planned March 26 release date to an unannounced date.

Here is the full message from Dragami Games on the delay:

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition had been scheduled for release on March 26, 2026. However, due to the need for significant updates not only to the Nintendo Switch 2 version but also to the currently released Nintendo Switch version, we have made the difficult decision to postpone the release.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused to all fans who have been eagerly awaiting this title.

We will announce the new release date as soon as preparations are complete.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 12, 2024, followed by PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on December 2, 2024. Total sales surpassed 300,000 units on August 12, 2025.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/lollipop-chainsaw-repop-nintendo-switch-2-edition-delayed-to-unannounced-date

item.title: DYPING: ESCAPE launches March 13
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Horror typing game priced at $9.99.

Horror typing game DYPING: ESCAPE will launch for PC via Steam on March 13 for $9.99, publisher PLAYISM and developer Heaviside Creations announced.

Here are the latest details, via PLAYISM:

About

The horror typing game DYPING, which garnered over 500,000 plays and gained much acclaim on the free game site unityroom, arrives on Steam on March 13, titled DYPING: ESCAPE, evolving the horror experience even further.

With significantly expanded story and mechanics, the game has evolved into a title offering deeper immersion and a denser horror experience.

Your doom awaits as you type at the behest of the eyeballs on your screen.

Try to survive this cursed game with some help from an unusual cat.

This game includes scenes where information from the player’s PC environment is displayed within the game. When streaming or recording, enabling “Streamer Mode” is strongly recommended to prevent a loss of privacy.

Furthermore, we are participating in the Steam Next Fest, (starting on February 24) and a demo version is already available. Save data from the demo can be transferred to the full version, so please take this opportunity to play DYPING: ESCAPE and add it to your wishlist.

About the Game

“Let’s play a typing game. All you have to do is type what I tell you to. You don’t have to think at all.”

A pair of creepy, mysterious eyeballs is your game master. You’ll follow their instructions to progress through a typing game… but also be forced to sign a rather unreasonable contract.

Whatever you type becomes reality and is inflicted upon you. You might be asked to run programs you don’t want to, or even hack your own system in an act of self-destruction. You might have to watch in horror as your computer breaks down before your very eyes. There’s not much you can really do to fight against this, especially in a typing game… But with the help of a cat awakened from an ancient game, perhaps you can escape.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/dyping-escape-launches-march-13
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: MOUSE: P.I. for Hire delayed to April 16
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on March 19.

PlaySide Publishing and developer Fumi Games have delayed noir cartoon-inspired first-person shooter MOUSE: P.I. for Hire from its previously planned March 19 release date to April 16. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam.

Here is the full message from the companies on the delay:

Hello everyone,

Today, we have an important update to share with you all.

We have made the decision to move the release date of MOUSE: P.I. for Hire to April 16, 2026.

As we approach the final stages of development, we want to ensure we are taking the extra time and care needed to make MOUSE: P.I. for Hire an experience to remember. We remain unwavering in our goal to deliver you the best game we can, and that will take just an extra few weeks.

We are excited to share more of the game with you in the lead up to launch. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for your incredible support.

—Fumi Games and PlaySide Studios



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/mouse-pi-for-hire-delayed-to-april-16
